page.title: 03Wooler-Buildings
page.content: At the top of Church Street was Winton's Stores(now Miller's antique shop)an old established grocers.Below was the temperance Hotel and nearby a billiard hall was sited amidst the reach of Good Templar's Hall and the Rechabite Hall on Tenter Hill. Dulhousie Place was named after one of the Lady Tankervilles(when Wooler belonged to that family). The Marble Arch,a large tenement block was where the car-park is and the adjoining well-founded Police Station.Further down Church Street was a common lodging house(McLoughlin's) where vagrants could buy a night's lodging for a few coppers. There were 5 churches in the town- 3 Presbyterian,1 Church of England and 1 Roman Catholic.Now there are just 3.
